intro: Selinum filicifolium, commonly known as the fern-leaved selenium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
